results.title: Austin Powers in Goldmember
results.brief_description: The world’s most shagadelic spy continues his fight against Dr. Evil. This time, the diabolical doctor and his clone, Mini-Me, team up with a new foe — ‘70s kingpin Goldmember. While pursuing the team of villains to stop them from world domination, Austin gets help from his dad and an old girlfriend.

results.title: Austin Powers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jay Roach, Mike Myers, Jennifer Todd, Demi Moore, Suzanne Todd and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Comedian Mike Myers (Wayne’s World) takes on the dual role of sixties super spy, renowned fashion photographer and insatiable casanova Austin Powers and his arch-enemy Dr Evil in this colourful parody of the James Bond films. Starting off in swinging London of the sixties, the film quickly moves into the present when Austin Powers must travel across time to stop Dr. Evil’s world conquering exploits, who has cryogenically frozen himself (and his cat Mr. Bigglesworth) and resurfaced in the nineties. Much of the films fish out of water humour is based on the difficulty Austin has in adjusting to a modern world that has little tolerance for a promiscuous, sexist, British secret agent with bad teeth and Dr Evil’s thwarted plans to outsmart a society that is far more advanced in notions of evil. Cast also includes Mimi Rogers, Elizabeth Hurley, Michael York and Robert Wagner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jay Roach, Mike Myers, Jennifer Todd, Demi Moore, Suzanne Todd and New Line Cinema

results.title: Austeria = The Inn [NTSC]
results.brief_description: A psychological drama set during World War 1. A group of Jewish civilians living in Polish Galicia flee from the Cossacks and become trapped in a tiny inn. As time passes, fear gives way and relationships between both the civilians and the inn keepers family develop, whilst still fearing that they will be discovered at any moment. This film won the Golden Lion award at the Gdynia Polish Film Festival. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Aussie fit: getting started
results.creator_credit: Debbie Hides, John Novak, Bryan Lowe and BM International
results.brief_description: This gentle routine for beginners is designed for all shapes, sizes and ages to burn off that excess weight and to gently tone flagging muscles. Follow the exercises at your own pace and gradually work up to a level that suits your individual needs. Also included is a bonus stretch section that shows how to achieve flexibility and suppleness throughout the body. WARNING: Please take note and heed the cautionary warning at the beginning of this video.

results.title: Aussie assault
results.creator_credit: Harvey Spencer, Bill Scholer, Garry Holt and Sportmaster Programs
results.brief_description: A behind-the-scenes look at the work and preparation that went into Australia II winning entry in the America’s Cup. Shows the crew at leisure as well as at work.

results.title: Auslang = Australian supply language
results.brief_description: About creating order from confusion and adapting a more disciplined approach to inventory identification in industry. Standard names are vital and AUSLANG (Australian Supply Language) offers a comprehensive dictionary together with colloquial cross references thus reducing the incidence of duplication of stock. AUSLANG was derived from the NATO codification system for Australian Industry use

results.title: Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5
results.creator_credit: Raffi Ghazarian, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and VSDC Services for Deaf Children
results.brief_description: Brian Bemal presents 5 episodes of Auslan signing pertaining to general conversation: family, school, shopping, food and play, with each episode building on the next. The video is accompanied by a guidebook containing pages from the VSDC “Dictionary of Auslan” from which the numbered signs are taken. Approximately 900 signs are shown. Suitable for beginners.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Raffi Ghazarian, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and VSDC Services for Deaf Children

results.title: Auslan for families [five stories]
results.creator_credit: Raffi Ghazarian, Chisholm Institute Education Development Unit and VSDC Services for Deaf Children
results.brief_description: Companion piece to ‘Auslan for families: vocabulary. Episodes 1-5’ [313556], in which the signs demonstrated there are acted out in five scenes of varying length around the themes of family, school, shopping, food and play. Intended as a language teaching program for parents of deaf children from a non-English speaking background; a voiceover accompanies the signing. Performers include: Kathryn Smith, Gerard Hynes, Caitlyn Johnson, Trent Beasly.
